software_list.comprehensive_overview: TensorFlow is an open-source machine learning library developed by Google for deep learning and neural networks. It allows for the creation of complex machine learning models with a focus on performance, scalability, and ease of use.
software_list.core_features: Flexible architecture, extensive support for deep learning techniques, easy model deployment, integration with other deep learning frameworks, distributed training capabilities.

software_list.comprehensive_overview: GROMACS is a molecular dynamics simulation software designed for simulating the behavior of biomolecules and other molecular systems. It is widely used in the field of computational chemistry and bioinformatics.
software_list.core_features: High performance, parallel computing capabilities, support for a wide range of force fields, extensive analysis tools, compatibility with various file formats.

software_list.comprehensive_overview: PyTorch is an open-source machine learning library developed by Facebook's AI Research lab. It is known for its dynamic computational graph approach, making it more intuitive for building neural networks and deep learning models.
software_list.core_features: Dynamic computation, strong GPU acceleration, easy debugging and visualization, seamless Python integration, support for dynamic neural networks.

software_list.comprehensive_overview: BLAST (Basic Local Alignment Search Tool) is a bioinformatics tool used for comparing biological sequences. It is widely utilized for sequence similarity searches in genetic databases to identify homologous sequences.
software_list.core_features: Fast sequence alignment, statistical significance assessment, various search modes, customizable parameters, support for different sequence databases.
